decks.notes: The deck aims to combo off using Lazav, Kethis, and Diligent Excavator to mill through the deck and generate value by recurring cheap legendary creatures like Fblthp and Teshar. Teferi, Time Raveler and Ashiok, Dream Render provide disruption and protection, while Tamiyo, Collector of Tales helps with consistency. Urza's Ruinous Blast serves as a board wipe option. The mana base is optimized for all colors needed to cast the various cards in the deck. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful graveyard-based strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lazav's ability to copy key combo pieces from the graveyard, such as Teshar, Kethis, and Diligent Excavator, to create a powerful engine of recursion and card advantage. Tamiyo and Teferi help protect the combo pieces and provide additional card selection. Mox Amber and Oath of Kaya provide mana ramp and removal to control the board. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence and overwhelming advantage.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to establish early board presence with aggressive creatures like Adanto Vanguard and Tenth District Legionnaire, while utilizing spells like Defiant Strike and Gods Willing to protect them and push through damage. Feather, the Redeemed serves as a powerful recurring threat, while Gideon Blackblade and Legion Warboss provide additional attacking options. Reckless Rage and Shock offer removal options to clear the way for attacks. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to heavily disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to maintain control of the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Kaya's Wrath while also generating card advantage and limiting the opponent's options with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful finishers like Command the Dreadhorde and Bolas's Citadel to close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently disrupted.

The deck revolves around controlling the game through cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Kaya's Wrath to dictate the pace of the match. It also utilizes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Thought Erasure to disrupt the opponent's game plan and prevent them from gaining momentum. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana, Dreadhorde General and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional value and utility. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outplay the opponent by maintaining control of the board and resources.

The main focus of this deck is to establish a strong control over the game by utilizing powerful removal spells and board wipes like Casualties of War and Star of Extinction. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping up mana with cards like Circuitous Route and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim to eventually overwhelm them with a horde of Zombie tokens generated by Field of the Dead. With a mix of removal, ramp, and a strong win condition, the Jund Control deck seeks to dominate the late game and secure victory.

The main objective of this deck is to put together a combination of cards that synergize well with Lazav, the Multifarious in order to create a powerful win condition. The deck includes cards like Diligent Excavator and Kethis, the Hidden Hand to help mill through the deck quickly, while also utilizing cards like Mox Amber and Fblthp, the Lost for additional card advantage and mana ramp. With powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales for control and card selection, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with efficient and aggressive creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion, Legion Lieutenant, and Adanto Vanguard. It also utilizes vampire synergies with cards like Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord and Sanctum Seeker to drain the opponent's life total. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast clock, while also having removal options like Cast Down and Legion's End to deal with threats. The mana base is optimized for consistent casting of spells, allowing for a smooth curve and aggressive gameplay.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Arboreal Grazer, Elvish Rejuvenator, and Circuitous Route to eventually play powerful control cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deputy of Detention. The goal is to control the board with removal spells like Time Wipe and Deputy of Detention while generating value with cards like Hydroid Krasis. The main win condition is to flood the board with Zombie tokens from Field of the Dead using cards like Scapeshift. The deck aims to out-value opponents and overwhelm them with its late-game power.

This Esper Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Kaya's Wrath and Basilica Bell-Haunt for removal and disruption, while Thought Erasure and Narset, Parter of Veils help with card advantage and filtering. Command the Dreadhorde provides a strong finisher option. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency in casting spells.

The main idea of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's strategy through hand disruption, board wipes, and removal spells while gaining card advantage through card draw and planeswalker activations. The deck aims to control the game by efficiently dealing with threats and maintaining a strong defensive position until it can ultimately win through powerful threats like Nicol Bolas, Dragon-God and Chandra, Awakened Inferno. With a focus on resource management and disruption, this deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver opposing decks in a long, grindy game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lazav's ability to transform into key creatures in the graveyard, combined with cards like Kethis and Diligent Excavator to mill cards and fuel the combo. Teferi and Tamiyo help with card selection and protection, while Jace provides an alternate win condition. Urza's Ruinous Blast and Oath of Kaya help control the board, while Mox Amber provides ramp. Ashiok can disrupt opponents' strategies, making it easier to assemble the combo. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements.

The deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with creatures like Tenth District Legionnaire and Gruul Spellbreaker, while protecting them with cards like Gods Willing and Sheltering Light. The key strategy is to trigger the abilities of Feather, the Redeemed and Season of Growth, allowing for card draw and creature recursion. The deck also includes removal spells like Shock and Reckless Rage to maintain board control. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast creatures and combat tricks.

The main focus of this Orzhov Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with low-cost creatures like Skymarcher Aspirant and Vicious Conquistador, buffed by cards like Legion Lieutenant and Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord, to apply pressure and drain the opponent's life total. The deck also includes removal spells like Cast Down and Legion's End to deal with threats, while cards like Champion of Dusk and Sanctum Seeker provide card advantage and additional damage. Ramp into Legion's Landing helps to maintain a steady stream of creatures as the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The main focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. The deck includes a mixture of low-cost creatures like Goblin Instigator and Gutterbones, as well as powerful finishers like Judith, the Scourge Diva and Rampaging Ferocidon. The strategy revolves around dealing damage quickly and efficiently, using cards like Lightning Strike and Shock to control the board and maintain pressure. Additionally, cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods provide additional utility by sacrificing creatures for added benefits.

This deck focuses on generating card advantage and ramping into powerful threats to control the game. By using cards like Tamiyo, Collector of Tales to recur key spells, Quasiduplicate to duplicate powerful creatures, and Nexus of Fate to take extra turns, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents. Hydroid Krasis provides a big threat and lifegain, while cards like Wildgrowth Walker and Risen Reef help to stabilize and ramp. The goal is to establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and powerful threats.
